nodes.bodyText: Why did you add the part about not using them together? It should work just fine :)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -234,10 +234,10 @@ When nodes detect that an entry reaches the maximum idle time, {brandname}
 removes it from the cache and does not return the entry to the client that
 requested it.
 
-Before using clustered `max-idle`, you should review the following points:
+Before using `max-idle` with clustered cache modes, you should review the following points:
 
 * `Cache.get()` does not return until the touch commands complete. This synchronous behavior increases latency of client requests.
-* Clustered `max-idle` also updates the recent access count for eviction on all owners.
+* Clustered `max-idle` also updates the "recently accessed" metadata for cache entries on all owners, which affects eviction. You shouldn't use `max-idle` with clustered cache modes together with eviction.

nodes.bodyText: So technically this isn't just 11.0 still, which is why I was asking on Zulip if we should put something here. Cause technically this change will be in 10.1.1 as well.

It actually makes performance worse :)
It improves consistency under node failure.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,17 @@
+= Upgrading from 10.1 to 11.0
+
+== Maximum Idle Timeouts with Clustered Cache Modes
+Infinispan maximum idle expiration has been changed to improve performance with

nodes.bodyText: Sorry to keep beating this dog, but should we mention that performance will be slower?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,16 @@
 = Upgrading from 10.0 to 10.1
 
+== Maximum Idle Timeouts with Clustered Cache Modes
+Maximum idle expiration has been changed to improve data consistency with clustered cache modes when Infinispan nodes fail.
